meanings.definition: To delay a student's entry into kindergarten for a year.
meanings.sent1: The parents decided to redshirt their child for kindergarten to give them more time to develop.
meanings.sent2: Many parents consider redshirting their children if they feel they are not ready for school.
meanings.sent3: The teacher joked that the teddy bear was redshirting in the toy box until next year.
meanings.sent4: Redshirting a child is like pausing their academic journey for a while to ensure they are prepared.
meanings.sent5: The concept of redshirting in kindergarten can be a strategic decision for some families.

meanings.definition: A practice in sports where a player sits out a season to extend their eligibility.
meanings.sent1: The coach considered redshirting the star player to give them an extra year of eligibility.
meanings.sent2: Redshirting in college sports can provide athletes with more time to develop their skills.
meanings.sent3: The basketball team joked that the basketball was redshirting on the bench for the next game.
meanings.sent4: Redshirting a player can be a strategic move to ensure they have a longer career in sports.
meanings.sent5: The idea of redshirting in sports is to maximize the player's potential over time.

meanings.definition: The act of holding a military officer back from promotion.
meanings.sent1: The general decided on redshirting the officer to provide them with more experience before promotion.
meanings.sent2: Redshirting in the military can be a way to ensure officers are fully prepared for higher ranks.
meanings.sent3: The sergeant joked that the new recruit was redshirting in the barracks until they were ready for duty.
meanings.sent4: Redshirting an officer is like giving them extra training before advancing in rank.
meanings.sent5: The practice of redshirting in the military aims to enhance leadership skills before promotion.
